meanings.definition: A synthetic polymer consisting of multiple lysine amino acids.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of polylysine in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The polylysine material was used to create a new type of biodegradable plastic.
meanings.sent3: The students joked that the polylysine looked like a colorful spaghetti made of lysine.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like polylysine, connecting ideas together to form a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The image of polylysine under the microscope was fascinating, resembling a chain of tiny beads.

meanings.definition: A substance used in cell culture to promote cell adhesion.
meanings.sent1: The researchers added polylysine to the cell culture to help the cells stick together.
meanings.sent2: Polylysine is commonly used in laboratories to ensure cells attach well to the surface.
meanings.sent3: The cells seemed to dance happily on the polylysine-coated dish, enjoying the extra grip.
meanings.sent4: The polylysine acted like a glue, holding the cells in place for observation.
meanings.sent5: The importance of polylysine in cell culture cannot be overstated, as it plays a crucial role in cell adhesion.
